title: Throttle Body - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Battery Disconnect DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DVY; DX4; DW4; DW; DVX; DV

body.body: Side Panel Removal DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DX4; DW4; DW; DVX; DVY; DV

body.body: Airbox Removal DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DX4; DW4; DW; DVX; DVY; DV

body.body: Protect the frame, crankcase, crankcase covers and starter motor painted surfaces from damage, using suitable self adhesive tape such as masking tape.
Remove the clamps securing the airbox ducts and remove the airbox ducts. Note the orientation for installation.

body.name: Airbox Hose Clamps Throttle Body DV (L0243)

body.body: Note the routing for the throttle actuator and throttle position harnesses for installation.
Disconnect the throttle actuator motor multiplug.
Release the locking device and detach the throttle position sensor multiplug from the mounting bracket.
Disconnect the throttle position sensor multiplug from the main harness.
Note which spigots on the throttle bodies the MAP sensor hose is fitted to and, if fitted, which spigot the evaporative emissions hose is fitted to for installation.
Disconnect the MAP hoses and the evaporative emissions hoses (if fitted) from the throttle bodies.
The clamps securing the throttle bodies to the transition pieces have a spacer fitted between the clamp ends.
The threaded lug is not secure and may fall out when the fixing has been released.
Remove the throttle body two hose clamps.
Carefully detach the throttle bodies from the transition piece hoses and remove the throttle bodies.
To remove the transition pieces from the cylinder head, remove the fixings and remove the transition piece(s).

A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.

The threaded lug is not secure and may fall out when the fixing has been released.
Remove the throttle body two hose clamps.
Evaporative hose (if fitted)
MAP sensor hose
